New SOI code, in many ways, is absolutely thumping everything else in the feature list. (assuming it works)

The old wild-SOI-ride BS was **AGGRESSIVELY OBNOXIOUS** and needed to DIE in a major way. And when I say "BS", I don't mean a Bachelor of Science, kids.

Bugfixes like that don't have the "new-car smell", aren't all "shiny next-gen HD", but they are absolutely critical to a good product.

Every time I warp though an SOI in 1.0, I'm going to reflect on that change and thank Harv for doing the *right thing* by fixing it.
